title.narrative: 001 CHILD FOCUSED SOCIAL WELFARE

description.narrative: 150 woredas provide sustainable, comprehensive, child-focused social welfare services to vulnerable children and adolescents as part of an integrated social protection scheme, which contributes to Access To Justice, Child Protection â€“ Strengthen Families And Communities, Prevention And Response Services For Violence Against Children. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: 'By 2020, an increased number of children, including adolescents at risk of or who have experienced violence, exploitation and abuse and harmful practices (notably child marriage and FGM/C) in emergency and non-emergency settings, benefit from quality, gender-sensitive, community-based and formal child protection services (i.e. social welfare, justice/law enforcement) and other appropriate services (I.e., social protection etc.). An increased number of children up to 5 years have their birth registered with civil authorities
